message_1: Suppose that John has a collection of marbles. If he gives away one-third of his marbles and then gives away three more, he will have 21 left. How many marbles did John have originally?
message_2:
Let x be the number of marbles John originally had. If he gives away one-third of his marbles, he will have 2/3x marbles left. Then, he gives away 3 more marbles, so he has (2/3x - 3) marbles left. We know that he has 21 marbles left after giving away the marbles, so we can set up the equation:

(2/3x - 3) = 21

Now, we can solve for x:

2/3x - 3 + 3 = 21 + 3
2/3x = 24

To isolate x, we can multiply both sides of the equation by 3/2:

(3/2)(2/3x) = 24(3/2)
x = 36

So, John originally had 36 marbles.
